div.h4: Welcome to Hanover-Horton School District where we are creating a better world, one student at a time.
div.p: At Hanover-Horton, we are committed to academic excellence. Our graduating class of 2019 had nearly 60% graduate with at least a 3.0 GPA. As a group, they qualified for over $2 million in scholarships and grants. Our high school offers students the opportunity to take college and Advanced Placement courses, participate in our engineering classes and choose from a wide variety of elective courses. Hanover-Horton High School has consistently scored among the areas best on the ACT and SAT for several years in a row!
Hanover-Horton Middle School has shown consistent gains on recent state tests. Students are able to take classes in engineering, art, computers, health…

div.h4: Welcome to Hanover-Horton School District where we are creating a better world, one student at a time.
div.p: At Hanover-Horton, we are committed to academic excellence. Our graduating class of 2019 had nearly 60% graduate with at least a 3.0 GPA. As a group, they qualified for over $2 million in scholarships and grants. Our high school offers students the opportunity to take college and Advanced Placement courses, participate in our engineering classes and choose from a wide variety of elective courses. Hanover-Horton High School has consistently scored among the areas best on the ACT and SAT for several years in a row!

p.span:
A huge thank you to many of the Hanover-Horton Elementary teachers for doing drive-by visits these past few weeks to check on their students. The smiles on the faces show you how much these teachers mean to our community!
Thank you to Mrs.Duffrin, Ms.Brockie, Mrs.Vinton, Mrs.Bulgrien, Mrs.Pond and Mrs.LaFollette for making a huge impact on your students!
Has a teacher gone above and beyond for your student? Please email any shoutouts to john.denney@hanoverhorton.org to help feature these positive interactions in our community.

img.alt: A huge thank you to many of the Hanover-Horton Elementary teachers for doing drive-by visits these past few weeks to check on their students. The smiles on the faces show you how much these teachers mean to our community! Thank you to Mrs.Duffrin, Ms.Brockie, Mrs.Vinton, Mrs.Bulgrien, Mrs.Pond and Mrs.LaFollette for making a huge impact on your students! Has a teacher gone above and beyond for your student? Please email any shoutouts to john.denney@hanoverhorton.org to help feature these positive interactions in our community.

div.p: I am sure it brighten the kids and teachers day :)

p.span: We are so lucky to have so many incredible women in our offices across the district! A huge thank you to each of them for all they do!

img.alt: We are so lucky to have so many incredible women in our offices across the district! A huge thank you to each of them for all they do!

div.p: Thank you for always being there for us! You are beyond appreciated not just today, but all thru the year!! 🙌🏻❤️
Happy Day Mrs. Bapst and Mrs. Fielder! Wish we could have brought you each a treat.
Thank you too each and every one of you. You all are absolutely amazing. GO COMETS
The ladies at HH elem take great care of our kiddos 💚💚💚
Thank you so much for always taking time with all of our needs! You have a heart for the whole school!!!
Thank you for always taking the time to answer my questions and helping me with anything and everything-you are all amazing!!!
Thank you!! We have the best secretaries around!
Thank you for always taking care of us!!! We truly appreciate all you do!!! ❤️
They are all wonderful and always so helpful!
Thank you ladies I appreciate you all.
HH has the best—have a great day, ladies!
You ladies are such an important part of the district! Thinking of you today. ❤️

div.p: Congratulations Class of 2020! We are proud of you!
Congrats Roo Boo, and to all of class of 2020
🙏🏻 Thank you from this Senior Mama❤️❤️❤️
Very special tribute to the Class of 2020. I had my porch light on for those 20 minutes!!!
Awesome. We love it!! 👨‍🎓❤ Damon Preston
Nick took some drone footage that he is going to try and upload. Nice tribute to the graduating class.
Congratulations class of 2020! Proud of you all!
Thank you from this senior Grandma.

With that in mind, I can see a best case scenario exist that we are back in school after our normal spring break. Athletics may happen quickly after that. Please take int...

p.span: All Winter Sports are Suspended Immediately

p.a: All Winter Sports are Suspended Immediately

div.span: The MHSAA has suspended all winter tournaments effective Thursday afternoon. The MHSAA will re-evaluate the situation and provide press releases as updates warrant. This means that the boys district final game scheduled for tomorrow against Homer at Concord is postponed. The MHSAA ban does not affec...

div.span: Kassidy Alexander became the second Hanover-Horton bowler to win a state championship Saturday. Kassidy had to qualify for matchplay and then defeated 5 different girls in winning the state championship.

div.p: It is the policy of the Board of Education not to discriminate on the basis of Protected Classes in its educational programs and activities and employment. Protected Classes generally include race, color, national origin, sex (including sexual orientation or transgender identity), disability, age, religion, height, weight, marital status, military status, ancestry, genetic information and such others as are defined in federal or state law. More detailed information can be found in the Board of Education Policies on this website. Inquiries and complaints regarding discrimination in programming and employment may be referred to any of the following: John Denney, Superintendent, 517-563-0100 or Denise Bergstrom, Middle School Principal, 517-563-0102.
